ruleset.name: ruleset
ruleset.description: Ruleset for zita focusing on basic coding practices, variable usage, and event handling in Processing programs used at macquarie university in COMP1000 - introduction to computer programming.

rule.name: HasVariableRule
rule.message: File must declare at least one variable.
rule.description: Reports when a Java compilation unit contains no variable declarations.

rule.name: HasHeaderCommentRule
rule.message: File should contain a header comment with a link
rule.description: Checks if the file contains a header comment with a URL/link.

rule.name: ProcessingJavaBuildRule
rule.message: Sketch must build successfully
rule.description: Checks if the Processing sketch builds successfully using processing-java --build.

rule.name: HasUserDefinedMethod
rule.message: No user-defined methods found.
rule.description: Reports if there are no user-defined methods in the code (excluding standard lifecycle methods).
rule.example: // No method declared // ❌ flagged void helper() {} // ✅ not flagged

rule.name: HasStandardProcessingStructure
rule.message: Program does not follow standard Processing structure (missing or incorrect setup() and/or draw()).
rule.description: Ensures a Processing sketch defines the standard lifecycle methods: a parameterless void setup() and a parameterless void draw().

rule.name: ThisKeywordUsageRule
rule.message: The 'this' keyword is used.
rule.description: Reports usage of the 'this' keyword in the code.
rule.example: this.x = 5; // ❌ flagged

rule.name: AdvancedProcessingFunctionRule
rule.message: Advanced Processing functions are used.
rule.description: Reports usage of advanced Processing functions (e.g., translate, rotate, scale, pushMatrix, popMatrix).
rule.example: translate(50, 100); // ❌ flagged rotate(PI/4); // ❌ flagged

rule.message: The {0} ''{1}'' seems to be complex. Consider reviewing or refactoring it for clarity.

rule.name: HasClassUsageRule
rule.message: Non-standard Java classes are used.
rule.description: Reports usage of Java classes that are not part of the standard or intended API.
rule.example: ArrayList<Integer> list = new ArrayList<>(); // ❌ flagged

rule.name: HasTernaryOperatorRule
rule.message: Ternary operator is used.
rule.description: Reports use of the ternary (conditional) operator.
rule.example: int max = (a > b) ? a : b; // ❌ flagged

rule.name: HasForEachLoopRule
rule.message: For-each loop is used.
rule.description: Reports use of the enhanced for-each loop.
rule.example: for (int n : numbers) { ... } // ❌ flagged

rule.name: HasArrayUsageRule
rule.message: No arrays are used in this code.
rule.description: Reports if no arrays are used in the code.
rule.example: // No arrays declared in the code // ❌ flagged int[] arr = new int[5]; // ✅ not flagged

rule.name: HasNonVoidFunctionRule
rule.message: No non-void functions found.
rule.description: Reports if there are no user-defined functions with a return type other than void.
rule.example: int add(int a, int b) { return a + b; } // ✅ void doSomething() { ... } // not enough alone

rule.name: HasFunctionWithParametersRule
rule.message: No functions with parameters found.
rule.description: Reports if there are no user-defined functions with parameters.
rule.example: void move(int dx, int dy) { ... } // ✅ void doSomething() { ... } // not enough alone

rule.name: HasAccessModifierRule
rule.message: An access modifier (private, public, protected, or package-private) is used.
rule.description: Reports use of any access modifier (private, public, protected, or package-private) on fields or methods.
rule.example: private int secret; // ❌ flagged public int count; // ❌ flagged protected void helper() { ... } // ❌ flagged int value; // ❌ flagged (package-private)

rule.name: HasFinalVariableRule
rule.message: The 'final' keyword is used on a variable.
rule.description: Reports use of the 'final' keyword on variables (fields).
rule.example: final int MAX = 10; // ❌ flagged

rule.name: UsingUserDefinedClass
rule.message: A user-defined class is declared but not used.
rule.description: Reports if a user-defined class is declared but not instantiated or referenced in the code.

rule.name: HasUserDefinedConstructor
rule.message: A user-defined class does not have an explicit constructor.
rule.description: Reports if a user-defined class does not define at least one explicit constructor.

rule.name: HasUserDefinedClass
rule.message: No user-defined class found.
rule.description: Reports if there is no user-defined class declared in the code.

rule.name: VariableArithmeticRule
rule.message: Few or no arithmetic operations using variables found.
rule.description: Reports if the code contains few or no arithmetic operations involving variables.

rule.name: Has2DShapesRule
rule.message: Few or no 2D shapes found in the code.
rule.description: Reports if the code contains few or no 2D primitive shapes.

rule.name: HasConditionsRule
rule.message: Few or no conditional statements found.
rule.description: Reports if the code contains few or no conditional statements (if, if-else, or ternary operator).

rule.name: HasLoopRule
rule.message: Few or no loops found in the code.
rule.description: Reports if the code contains few or no loops (for, while, or do-while).

rule.name: HasEventHandlerRule
rule.message: No event handler methods found.
rule.description: Reports if the code contains no event handler methods (such as mousePressed, keyPressed, etc.).

rule.name: HasDrawRule
rule.message: No draw() method found.
rule.description: Reports if the code does not contain a draw() method.

rule.name: HasSetupRule
rule.message: No setup() method found.
rule.description: Reports if the code does not contain a setup() method.

rule.name: DecentralizedDrawingRule
rule.message: Do not use drawing method {0} in method {1}, {1} is called outside of the draw sequence and can therefore not contain drawing methods.
rule.description: Methods that draw on screen should only be called from drawing methods: methods that are (indirectly) called solely by the draw method.

rule.name: DecentralizedEventHandlingRule
rule.message: Do not use global event variable {0} in method {1}, as {1} is not one of the event handling methods.
rule.description: Global event handling variables should only be used inside the specified event handler methods.

rule.name: LongMethodRule
rule.message: The method {0} is too long, {1} lines of code are counted. The method should be made more efficient, split in multiple methods, or responsibilty should be delegated to other objects/classes.
rule.description: Methods longer than a certain amount of rules (50 by default) should be split into separate method calls.
rule.example: void method() { //Wrong: method is too long. println("T") println("h") println("i") println("s") println("") println("m") println("e") println("t") println("h") println("o") println("d") println("") println("i") println("s") println("") println("w") println("a") println("y") println("") println("t") println("o") println("o") println("") println("l") println("o") println("n") println("g") }

rule.name: LongParameterListRule
rule.message: The method {0} has too many parameters, {1} are counted. The parameters should be merged into objects or the method should be split.
rule.description: Methods should not accept too many parameters.

rule.name: PixelHardcodeIgnoranceRule
rule.message: Do not use literals for pixels for {0} inside method {1}.
rule.description: Drawing functions should not use pixels, but constants or variables instead.

rule.name: StatelessClassRule
rule.message: Class {0} does not declare any fields. The class should be removed by moving methods to the global scope.
rule.description: Stateless classes are not allowed. Utility classes with only methods should define their methods in the top class (global scope).

rule.name: GodClassRule
rule.message: The class {0} has too much responsibility. The program design should be reconsidered (God Class, WMC={1}, ATFD={2}, TCC={3})
rule.description: Classes should not become a God Class, e.g. they should not take total responsibility for the whole application.

rule.name: OutOfScopeStateChangeRule
rule.message: Do not change variable {0} in the {1}, as {0} is not defined within the scope of class.
rule.description: Variables, that are defined outside the scope of a class, should never have their state altered even if they class has access to them. Boolean expressions are allowed however.

rule.name: HasModuloOperatorRule
rule.message: Program uses the modulo operator (%) somewhere in the code.
rule.description: Flags usage of the modulo operator (%) anywhere in the code, including inner classes.
rule.example: int x = 10 % 3; // ❌ flagged

rule.name: HasNoElseStatementRule
rule.message: No 'else' statement found in the program.
rule.description: Flags if the program does not contain any 'else' statement.

rule.name: HasNoBooleanOperatorRule
rule.message: No boolean operator found in the program.
rule.description: Flags if the program does not contain any boolean operator.

rule.name: HasImportStatementRule
rule.message: Import statement found in the program.
rule.description: Flags if the program contains any import statement.
rule.example: // No import statement // ✅ not flagged import java.util.*; // ❌ flagged

rule.name: HasAbstractClassOrInterfaceRule
rule.message: Abstract class or interface declared in the program.
rule.description: Flags if the program declares any abstract class or interface, including inner classes.
rule.example: abstract class MyAbstractClass {} // ❌ flagged interface MyInterface {} // ❌ flagged class Outer { abstract class InnerAbstract {} // ❌ flagged interface InnerInterface {} // ❌ flagged } class Concrete {} // ✅ not flagged

rule.name: HasTripleNestedClassRule
rule.message: Class declared inside a class inside a class (triple nested class) found in the program.
rule.description: Flags if the program declares a class inside a class inside a class (triple nested class).

rule.name: EventHandlerNoDeclaredCallRule
rule.message: No event handler calls any declared method in the program.
rule.description: Flags if none of the event handler methods call any declared methods in the program. If at least one event handler calls a declared method, no violation is reported for any event handler.

rule.name: EventHandlerNoControlFlowRule
rule.message: No event handler contains a for loop or if statement.
rule.description: Flags if none of the event handler methods contain a for loop or if statement. If at least one event handler contains a for loop or if statement, no violation is reported for any event handler.

rule.name: ClassCallsDrawMethodRule
rule.message: An inner class method calls a draw method.
rule.description: Flags if no method inside an inner class calls any function listed in DRAW_METHODS (see ProcessingApplet.kt).

rule.name: UsefulEventHandlerRule
rule.message: Event handlers should contain control flow or call declared methods
rule.description: Checks that event handler methods are not too simplistic. They should either: - Contain control flow statements (if, for, while), OR - Call declared methods (user-defined functions)

rule.name: HasArrayIndexForLoop
rule.message: No index-based for loop found for array iteration.
rule.description: Flags if arrays are not iterated using a for loop with an index/counter. If an index-based for loop is found iterating an array, does not flag. If only for-each loops or no loops are used, flags the code.

rule.name: HasClassWithConstructorRule
rule.message: Classes should have explicit constructors
rule.description: Checks that user-defined classes have explicit constructors. Fails if no classes are found or if classes exist without constructors.

rule.name: HasInheritanceRule
rule.message: Inheritance found using the 'extends' keyword
rule.description: Flags if students are using inheritance through the extends keyword. Passes if no user-defined classes use inheritance. Fails if at least one user-defined class extends another class.
